intro: Racosperma johannis, commonly known as the John's raceme wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance through its deep root system and reduced leaf surface area. This species contributes to local biodiversity and is of interest in ecological and horticultural studies.
